page.title: 08LEE MOOR TIPS-LANDSCAPE.
page.content: Where china clay has been extracted, there have been two new forms of landscape produced.One type is the creation of large holes over a hundred metres deep.The other type is produced from what comes out of these large holes-waste.The material which makes up these waste tips is mainly sand. These large waste tips are arranged in layers of about twenty-five metres, producing a terraced effect.The most prominent of the tips is the Cholwich Town tip,which is situated below Penn Beacon.This tip is to be extended eastwards but not to cover Cholwich Town farmhouse,which is of historical interest.At present parts of the tips are being sprayed with a mixture of fertilizer,seed and cellulose in an attempt to establish vegetation.In time it is hoped that trees will be planted on the lower slopes.
